node.title: Could leasing nuclear submarines from the US address Australia's capability gap?
node.alt: HMAS Dechaineux participating in Exercise Kakadu 2010 off the coast of Darwin.
node.description: A former US navy intelligence officer says leasing US Los Angeles Class nuclear submarines should be considered to promptly upskill the Australian navy workforce and deal with an increasing threat from China.
node.content:
["A former US navy intelligence officer says leasing US Los Angeles Class nuclear submarines should be considered to promptly upskill the Australian navy workforce and deal with an increasing threat from China.", "Concerns about a capability gap come amid mounting questions about what the federal government's \"intention\" to build the new submarines in Adelaide means.", "Under the AUKUS pact signed in September, Australia's next fleet of submarines will be based on a US\u00a0 or UK boat design and be nuclear powered.", "But the first submarine is not expected to hit the water until about 2040.", "Retired US Navy Captain James Fanell spent almost three decades as an intelligence officer specialising in Indo-Pacific security affairs.", "He told 7.30 the delivery schedule of the new submarines was too far away.", "", "
James Fanell believes Australia should consider leasing nuclear submarines from the US until the new submarines are delivered.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "\"The PRC's (People's Republic of China's) maritime capabilities have dramatically increased in the last two decades.", "\"So the idea that you need submarines\u00a0[and] you can wait till 2040 or 2045 to get submarines \u2026 there are other options that could be pursued in the interim, as you're working the nuclear side of the house.\"", "The federal government has committed to upgrading the ageing Collins Class fleet to help plug the gap, but Captain\u00a0Fanell said it would make sense to also lease some US nuclear submarines in the interim.", "", "
The federal government has committed to upgrading the ageing Collins Class fleet.(ABC News: Dave Weber)
", "\"We have some Los Angeles Class boats that we're decommissioning, 11 over the next four or five years,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"They could be leased down to Australia, and I think the United States would be willing to do that.", "\"Maybe one or two of those could be \u2026\u00a0sent down to Australia and allowed to operate out of your ports, kind of on a temporary rotational deployment basis.\u00a0", "\"[That] would allow them \u2014 Australian submarine crews \u2014 to get training aboard nuclear submarines and expand their knowledge base and experience.\"", "Captain Fanell said the move would also allow the Australian public to get their heads around the idea that nuclear submarines were not\u00a0\"something that's dangerous.\"\u00a0", "
Upskilling required\u00a0
", "Independent senator\u00a0and former submariner Rex Patrick said significant work was needed to prepare Australia's diesel-electric skilled submariners to handle a nuclear boat.", "\"When I was doing trials on a US navy submarine, I spent time with some of the nuclear techs,\" he told 7.30.\u00a0", "\"They went to nuclear school,\u00a0they then went to a civilian reactor where they practised\u00a0their skills, where they learned to operate a reactor safely, before they were ever allowed to go to sea and operate a nuclear reactor underwater.\"", "", "
Rex Patrick says the new submarine plan is complicated because Australia does not have a civil nuclear industry.(ABC News: Lincoln Rothall)
", "The government is undertaking an 18-month\u00a0consultation period to plan for the new nuclear submarine fleet.", "Finance Minister Simon Birmingham acknowledged the skills gap was something Australia needed\u00a0to overcome.", "\"I think there are certainly a number of issues around training, understanding how best to operate [the submarines], the type of sustainment and infrastructure at wharves and ports that are necessary that will see increased cooperation with the US and the UK, through the life of this program,\" he told 7.30.", "
Where will the subs be built?
", "The federal government has said it intends to build the submarines in Adelaide.\u00a0However,\u00a0when asked if he could give an iron-clad guarantee, Mr Birmingham repeated the initial pledge.", "\"It is absolutely the government's intention to have as much as possible built in Adelaide and across Australia, and leverage all of the different supply chains that are available,\" he told 7.30.", "The government has flagged the new boats will be powered by nuclear reactors built overseas.", "Mr Birmingham would not be drawn on reports that meant the submarines might have only 40 per cent\u00a0local content.", "", "
Australian government\u00a0navy shipbuilding company ASC in Osborne, South Australia.(ABC News: Lincoln Rothall)
", "Under the now-scrapped French contract was a promise from shipbuilder Naval Group to spend at least 60 per cent\u00a0of the contract value in Australia.", "\"I think it is too early to speculate in terms of numbers.\u00a0We want to ensure we get as much as possible [for the new nuclear submarines],\" Mr Birmingham told 7.30.", "Martin Hamilton-Smith is a former South Australian Liberal leader turned independent who served as the state's defence industries minister. He\u00a0now heads up an industry lobby group called the Australian Sovereign Capability Alliance.", "He told 7.30 he was concerned Australia would not get its fair share of the work.", "", "
Martin Hamilton-Smith is concerned the majority of the nuclear submarines will be built overseas.\u00a0(ABC News: Lincoln Rothall)
", "\"The language being used by the government, that it will be built in Adelaide, doesn't provide much detail,\" he told 7.30.\u00a0", "\"It doesn't tell us to what extent it will be built in Australia, how much will be spent building it in Australia, how much of the smart intellectual property in engineering will be done in Australia, what dollar amounts will be spent.", "Mr Hamilton-Smith said the uncertainty reminded him of another chapter in the long, drawn-out history of the future submarine project.", "\"The last time we saw that language, the government was talking about building a submarine in Japan back in 2014,\" he said.", "\"We were told then that it would be built in Adelaide [only]\u00a0to find out the real plan was to build it there [in Japan and]\u00a0tow it out for final fit-out here.", "\"The history of this is something that is quite sobering.\"", "", "
The Naval Group head office in Port Adelaide.(ABC News: Eric Tlozek)
", "Senator Patrick said he was concerned the government's plans could change in the future, similar to the unexpected dumping of the French contract.", "\"By the time our first submarine gets into the water in 2040, we will have been through seven federal elections,\" he said.", "\"Scott Morrison will be 72, Boris Johnson will be 76, and Joe Biden will be 98.", "\"By the time we get to our last submarine in the series, Halley's Comet will have passed by again.", "\"I think after the election, after the 18-month study period, the government will announce that, indeed, they're going to go offshore to build these submarines.\"", "But Senator Birmingham said the public could have confidence in the AUKUS pact and Australia's commitment to sovereign shipbuilding.", "\"I encourage people to look at the rest of our naval shipbuilding program \u2014\u00a0the fact that we have seen successfully built air warfare destroyers, followed by offshore patrol vessels.", "\"This is all the demonstration that we're actually getting on building [and] delivering.\"", "
Businesses still counting the cost of cancelled French contract
", "Estimates from industry lobby groups suggest in South Australia, companies had invested $35 million to try to win work on the French contract.", "Rowlands Metalworks owner Cameron Johnston said he outlaid\u00a0about $100,000 after partnering with a French firm in the hope of securing work.", "", "
Cameron Johnston saw big possibilities for his small business when it was announced 12 French-designed submarines would be built in Adelaide.(ABC News: Lincoln Rothall)
", "\"Rowlands started a journey about three or four years ago\u00a0in looking at the submarine project\u00a0and what would be the potential commercial opportunities in that project,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"That ultimately fell apart when the decision was made to \u2026 cancel the contract with the French.", "\"I was surprised that it would happen\u00a0so unilaterally and so swiftly.\u00a0That really did take me by surprise.\"", "Mr Johnston said he was pursuing opportunities in other industries, with work on the new nuclear submarines now years away.", "\"There's no doubt that the defence opportunities are enormous,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"The problem I have is timing \u2014\u00a0that we are not in control of the timing and it can be moved, as we saw in the [French]\u00a0submarine contract, at the stroke of a pen.", "\"I don't think the submarine is of any interest to me personally, but it might be of more interest to my children.\"", "Senator Birmingham said the government would help affected businesses and former Naval Group employees find new work.", "\"I can understand that many people were looking forward to the opportunities of the Attack Class program,\" he said.", "\"But with the information the government had about the changed capability requirements for submarines operating in our region, the changed threats that we face as a nation, it would have been negligent for us to simply push ahead.\"", "Watch this story tonight on 7.30 on ABC TV and iview."]
